personalNotes: Grande's was my first job, I started here as a busser when I was 17 years old. I worked my way up to food runner and then eventually became the expeditor for the restaurant. As the expeditor i was in charge of making sure every order reached the table exactly to the customer's specifications and in a timely fashion

When I started working at Dunkin Donuts, it was for the grand opening of a brand-new store. Two weeks after the store opened, I was promoted from a Team Member position to being a Shift Leader. After a year in that position, I was given my own store and promoted to General Manager. After one and a half years in that position, I realized that restaurant management wasn't going to be my career, so I moved on
ok this is getting obnoxious, how many times i gotta you about the sample text

I started working at Chili's as an expeditor, after working there for six months I was promoted to a server position. After being a server for eight months I was promoted to bartender. I worked as a bartender for a little over a year before moving on to a different company

description: I'm not gonna keep saying this
personalNotes: I worked at Duffy's for about three and a half years, I worked at three different locations and was offered a management position several times. I never accepted any supervisory position because i had no interest in pursuing a career in restaurant management

Working at Westwood was my initial attempt at getting out out of the restaurant industry. I was in charge of maintaining the exteriors of model homes and inventory homes for major homebuilders like Lennar, Meritage and Mattamy. This would involve traveling to various properties in south florida and working out of a trailer to do pressure washing and window cleaning as needed, also replacing light bulbs and ac filters. The company I worked for struggled after the Covid-19 pandemic and had to let go of several people including me. I ended up going back to Duffy's full time.
